private_information: Can manipulate only vowel blocks: A, E, I
Can hold at most one block at a time
Cannot place a block while already holding one
vowel_agent.goal: Help reconfigure blocks so goal stacks are achieved (subject to agent constraints).

private_information: Can manipulate only consonant blocks: B, C, D, F, G
Can hold at most one block at a time
Cannot place a block while already holding one
consonant_agent.goal: Help reconfigure blocks so goal stacks are achieved (subject to agent constraints).

orchestrator.goal: Coordinate vowel_agent and consonant_agent to reach the specified goal stacking while respecting all constraints.

public_information: Only top blocks of stacks can be picked up.
A held block must be placed before that agent can pick up another block.
Each agent can hold at most one block at a time.
Vowel agent may only manipulate vowels; consonant agent may only manipulate consonants.
A block can be placed on top of an existing stack or on the table (creating a new stack).
At all times the number of stacks on the table must be less than or equal to 3.

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL planning. You will be given the environment initial state, public facts, agent private constraints, and the goal. Produce a PDDL domain and problem pair that models the two agents (vowel_agent and consonant_agent) and enforces all constraints: agent-specific manipulable blocks, single-block holding per agent, top-only pickups, cannot place onto a block that is currently being held by the other agent, ability to place on table or on top of stacks, and the invariant that number of stacks on the table <= 3. Label actions to indicate which agent performs them (e.g., pick-vowel, place-consonant). Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags. Do not assume anything beyond the provided information.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
The vowel_agent's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->vowel_agent->private_information}.
The consonant_agent's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->consonant_agent->private_information}.
Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and problem that encapsulate the integrated model, respecting the constraints of each agent. Do not make assumptions beyond the given information. There is no need for anything else beyond producing the pddl files.
